headline: Staff Picks From the Book Review
abstract: Suggested reading from critics and editors at The New York Times.
lead_paragraph: On the one hand: civil war, world war, economic turmoil. On the other hand: love, literature, the will to survive. Our recommended books this week take on the big topics, from James Wood’s collection of literary criticism and personal essays to Ann Napolitano’s novel about a plane crash to Daniel Susskind’s look at the impact of artificial intelligence on the labor force. There’s also the history of a 19th-century power couple (written by NPR’s Steve Inskeep), a debut novel about women’s interior lives and a study of everyday citizens in authoritarian Russia.
